content.description: An enjoyable route, with a 5.10A entry move, a long clean 5.7 hand crack, and a fairly well protected crux balancy face at the top.
content.location: This route starts from a ledge part way up the formation.  You need to rappel from the top to get to the start of the climb.

climbs.name: Get the Balance Right
climbs.fa: Vaino Kodas and Diana Leach, November 1984

content.description:
This route features very good climbing up a steep featured slab with interesting movement and quality rock for it's duration; it does however have ledgefall potential getting to the 2nd bolt so be careful as the car and help is a long ways away. Three stars out of five.

Until the old bolts are replaced on this it's perhaps best done as a toprope.
content.location:
Up and right from

One Pop, No Stop

. The easiest way to access this route is to rap from anchors on top down to the large ledge at the base of the route.

climbs.name: Face Race
climbs.fa: Vaino Kodas, Alan Nelson & Hans Lippuner, November 1984

content.description:
Climbs the steep slab up the center of the face. Only worth doing after climbing

All-reet Arete

. Zero stars out of five.
A fairly nice offwidth in a corner
content.protection: One #4 Camalot and a few smaller pieces.
content.location: This crack is to the left of All-Reet Arete and Face Race.

climbs.name: All-reet Arete
climbs.fa: Alan Nelson, Vaino Kodas, Hans Lippuner, Diana Leach, Amy Lippuner & Lori Leach, November 1984

content.description: A fairly nice face climb up a buttress, with a long runout on 5.6 moves
content.location: This climb starts on the ground, to the right of the center of the formation.
